sense.def:
To guard a place, person, or object
pomeni paziti neki kraj, osebo ali predmet, bodisi zato, da bi jih zavarovali, bodisi zato, da bi jim preprečili beg.

seg.quote: Scotland Yard sent an officer to guard his house.
She had been locked in her room and was guarded night and day.

sense.def:
A guard
je oseba ali skupina oseb, ki nekoga ali nekaj varujejo ali stražijo.

seg.quote: They will give him an armed guard.

sense.def:
A guard
je tudi železniški uslužbenec na vlaku.

To guard something
pomeni varovati ali skrivati nekaj pomembnega ali tajnega.

seg.quote: The professions, as you might expect, guard their secrets closely.
The contents of the lists were a closely guarded secret.

sense.def:
A guard
je tudi pokrov za nekaj nevarnega.

seg.quote: When the guard is taken off the motor the machine can't start.

sense.def:
To stand guard over someone or something
pomeni nekoga ali nekaj stražiti.

seg.quote: You will be expected to stand guard over the village.

sense.def:
To be on guard
pomeni biti odgovoren za varovanje določenega kraja ali osebe.

To be on one's guard
pomeni paziti, ker bi okoliščine lahko postale resne ali nevarne.

seg.quote: Busy parents have to be on their guard against being bad-tempered with their children.

sense.def:
To catch someone off guard
pomeni nekoga presenetiti s tem, da nekaj naredimo takrat, ko ne pričakuje.

To guard against something
pomeni paziti, da bi se izognili temu, da bi se nekaj zgodilo ali vplivalo na nas.

seg.quote: ...ideas which the trained mind of a judge knows to guard against.
